text: [Music]
my name is Brian Wagner I am a security
consultant for AWS professional services
and I've been here four years
so as a security consultant my role is
to help customers adopt the cloud in a
way that is either on par or hopefully
exceeding their security standards of
what they were normally used to so I
joined AWS after a long career of
software development where I started to
get sort of pigeon-holed as a certain
type of developer and there's nothing
wrong with that but I see technology as
tools in a toolbox and you use the right
tool for the right job and at AWS I
really found that you know not just the
services themselves but the way we
approach customers I can sort of use
that opinion of technology and help
customers build things that are relevant
to them the most satisfying thing
working at AWS is I think AWS is
investment in people my experience has
been if I want to you know learn
something new I want to go to a
conference that I think is valuable to
my role or my customers
AWS will support it the way I prepared
for my AWS interview I thought it would
be great if I got certified as a
Solutions Architect but I failed my exam
a day before and actually that came up
in the interview instead of sort of that
being a problem the question the
interviewer asked me on the phone was
well what did you learn from that and I
thought that was really really
interesting the piece of advice I would
give someone that's just joining AWS is
definitely ask for help one thing in my
my four years here I've learned is that
if I want to know something or if I need
help on something
everyone will rush to - that a ask
questions raise your hand you will be
pleasantly surprised how supportive
everybody is
